Kalka-Shimla Toy Train: How to experience this UNESCO World Heritage Site

Nestled amidst the picturesque landscapes of Himachal Pradesh, the Kalka-Shimla Toy Train stands as a timeless relic of colonial-era engineering and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Embarking on this enchanting journey aboard the toy train offers travellers a glimpse into the bygone era of steam locomotives and Himalayan hill stations.

Embarking on the Kalka-Shimla Toy Train journey is not just a means of transportation; it's a nostalgic voyage through history and nature's splendour. From the rhythmic chugging of the steam engine to the panoramic vistas of the Himalayas, every moment spent aboard this UNESCO World Heritage Site is etched in memory as a testament to the timeless allure of mountain railways.

Here's how you can experience this iconic railway adventure:

Plan your journey

The journey typically starts from Kalka, a small town located in Haryana, which serves as the gateway to the Himalayan foothills. Consider the time of year for your visit, keeping in mind that the toy train operates throughout the year, offering unique experiences in each season. Summers provide pleasant weather and lush greenery.

Book your tickets

Reserve your tickets for the toy train well in advance, especially during peak tourist seasons, to ensure availability. Tickets can be booked online through the Indian Railways website or purchased at the Kalka Railway Station. Choose between different classes of accommodation on the toy train, including first-class, second-class, and chair car, based on your preferences and budget. This iconic route presents travellers with four types of train rides to choose from, catering to different preferences and budgets. The options include the luxurious Shivalik Deluxe, priced at INR 500, the Rail Motor at INR 300, the Himalayan Queen at INR 260, and the budget-friendly Shimla Kalka Express priced at INR 70.

Enjoy the scenic journey

Prepare to be mesmerised by the scenic beauty as the toy train chugs along the narrow-gauge tracks, traversing verdant valleys, dense forests, and quaint hillside villages. Keep your camera handy to capture the panoramic views of snow-capped peaks, cascading waterfalls, and meandering streams that adorn the route.

Explore Shimla

Upon reaching Shimla, the capital city of Himachal Pradesh, take some time to explore its colonial-era charm and architectural heritage. Visit iconic landmarks such as the Viceregal Lodge, Christ Church, and the Mall Road. Indulge in local cuisine at quaint cafes and restaurants, savouring traditional Himachali delicacies like chana madra, chicken anardana, and siddu.

Visit nearby attractions

Extend your exploration beyond Shimla to discover nearby attractions such as the historic town of Kufri, renowned for its panoramic views and adventure activities like skiing and tobogganing. Explore the serene surroundings of Mashobra and Naldehra, known for their lush greenery, apple orchards, and opportunities for nature walks and horse riding.
